Key Match Events: Glenn Phillips scored 104 off 64 balls, hitting 10 fours and four sixes.
Trent Boult took four wickets in a particularly impressive performance.
New Zealand lost three early wickets but recovered to post a total of 167.
Sri Lanka dropped Phillips on 12, which proved to be a costly mistake.
Phillips and Daryl Mitchell had an 84-run partnership.
Sri Lanka managed just 24 runs in the power play and were all out quickly.
Post-Match Reflections: Daryl Mitchell praised Glenn Phillips' performance, calling it 'unbelievable'.
Michael Clarke criticized Sri Lanka's fielding, noting it cost them significantly.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Wet weather the day before caused both matches in Melbourne to be washed out.
New Zealand's win put them at the top of Group 1 and in a strong position to make the semi-finals.
